title: Tales of mystery and imagination
creator_credit: Federico Fellini, Roger Vadim, Louis Malle, Produzioni Europee Associati and Les Films Marceau - Cocinor
brief_description: Tales of mystery and imagination brings together three short films by three of France’s greatest directors, based on the stories by Edgar Allan Poe. “William Wilson’s sketch” directed by Louis Malle and starring Terence Stamp. “Metzengerstein” directed by Roger Vadim and starring Jane Fonda. “Don’t bet heads” directed by Frederico Fellini and starring Brigit Bardot. Each one features a strange tale with an unexpected twist and thought-provoking performances from the stars.
